intro: Parageum reptans, commonly known as the creeping parageum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Parageum reptans is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
